questions.question_text: Which of the following tables exist within the GRC: Profiles application scope? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ADE
Answer:
 A. Document
 D. Content
 E. Indicator
Explanation: tables, name and application scope based on the current GRC application build
 - Document[sn_grc_document] | GRC: Profiles
 - Policy[sn_compliance_policy] | GRC: Policy and Compliance Management
 - Risk[sn_risk_risk] | GRC: Risk Management
 - Content[sn_grc_content] | GRC: Profiles
 - Indicator[sn_grc_indicator] | GRC: Profiles

Selected Answer: ADE
ADE are correct

Document[sn_grc_document], Content[sn_grc_content], and Indicator[sn_grc_indicator]
Ans: ADE

Selected Answer: ADE
Just did a search on the GRC: Profiles application scope in my instance. And Document[sn_grc_document], Content[sn_grc_content], and Indicator[sn_grc_indicator] all exist. Risk and Policy do not.

Selected Answer: ADE
a d e are correct

questions.question_text: There is a direct relationship between Entity Class and Entity Type when:
Which of the following are Policy Lifecycle states included in the ServiceNow baseline? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BD
Answer:
 B. Review
 D. Published
Explanation: Explanation: Policies go through, Draft > Review > Awaiting approval > Published > Retired, lifecycle
Source: https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/xanadu-governance-risk-compliance/page/product/grc-policy-and-compliance/task/t_DefineAPolicy.html

Selected Answer: BD
Draft > Review > Awaiting Approval > Published > Retired

Selected Answer: AC
Answer:
 A. Citation
 C. Control Objective
Explanation: Content[sn_grc_content] extending to following tables
 - Citation[sn_complance_citation]Question #26
 - Control object requirement[sn_compliance_policy_statement]The Citation table is a child table of which parent?
 - Risk Statment[sn_risk_definition] A. Content
 - Control object[sn_compliance_policy_statement]
Source; PDI, Content[sn_grc_content] Schema Map C. Item

Selected Answer: AC
ebook: GRC: Integrated Risk Management (IRM) Implementation - San Diego, Page 140
Control Objective and Citation

Selected Answer: AC
control object and citation
wrong - should be citation and control obj

questions.question_text: Which of the following extends from Content Table? (Choose two.)
Which tables extend from the Task table? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BD
risk event also extend from task table

Selected Answer: BD
Answer:
 B. Risk Response Task
 D. Risk Event
Explanation: looking at what task table extending to
 - Risk Response Task[sn_risk_response_task]
 - Risk Event[sn_risk_advanced_event]
Make sense to for task to extend to another task table, but Event technically isn't an extension of task, my assumption is Risk Event is the advance Risk Management stuff people need to pay extra money for, so it's more keen to a task than an even(?)
Source: PDI, task schema map

Selected Answer: BD
Confirmed in Schema map on lab instance
